answers.answer: Exercise, especially in hot weather causes your veins to be more prominent as your body is increasing blood flow to the skin for cooling. Your post did not included what you were doing "from time to time" making it difficult to ***** your problem. Also, I did not see the results of a medical exam which precludes any unknown/unseen analysis. If they are varicose veins there are simple treatments available. I suggest you see a doctor for a complete health checkup and ask to include testing for diabetes. Good luck
Diabetes is not something you believe you have. Get tested before you go blind, lose a leg or something equally horrific.
Why do you believe your Diabetic?  Go find out, or do you enjoy being in the dark?

question: I get pronounced veins below the knee from time to time it goes away. is this due to my blood sugar levels. I beleive i am diabetic
title: COO
